lines.text:
[Entering the nightclub]
Ah, sad music! - like Russian. Now, I can be depressed while I eat.
Say, Mr. Bennett, could I speak to you for a minute? Now you can stop me if you've heard this.

[Happily anticipating]
Oh, you've got a new story?
No. Oh, no. It's an old story, and you've probably heard it before... but here's how it goes... most scientists agree that one of the few things that can't be preserved in alcohol is a happy home.

[Referring to De Wolfe]
Denny, please don't be upset by what he said.
Every knock's a boost, you know.
And it doesn't matter what anyone says about you as long as they spell your name right.

[Referring to the baby's safety]
Are you daffy? Supposing he fell on his head or something?
That's nothing! I fell on my head twice when I was a baby.

[after being requested to sing]
Now, Mrs. Kelly, I park my voice when I park my cab.
Sometimes I feel like a cross between a nightengale and a carrier pigeon.
love is intoxication, marriage the headache, and divorce the spirin tablet.
Mr. Martin, I like singing, but not while I'm dictating.
Oh yeah? Well the world'd be a better place if there was more singing and less dictating.
